author: George Orwell
description: 1984 by George Orwell is a chilling tale of a future society controlled by an oppressive regime, where truth and freedom are obliterated.

name: Black Bird and the Oracle
author: Deborah Harkness
description: Black Bird by Deborah Harness explores a gripping tale of loss and redemption, blending mystery with profound emotional depth.

name: A Death in Cornwall
author: Daniel Silva
description: A Death in Cornwall by Daniel Silva is a riveting mystery featuring a detective unraveling a complex case against the scenic backdrop of Cornwall.

name: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The Hobbit by J.R.R. Tolkien is an adventurous tale of Bilbo Baggins, who embarks on an epic quest filled with danger and discovery.

name: Horse
author: Geraldine Brooks
description: Horse by Geraldine Brooks intertwines historical and contemporary narratives to explore the profound bond between humans and horses, revealing untold stories of both.

name: All This and More
author: Peng Shepherd
description: All This and More by Peng Shepherd delves into a dystopian world where love and survival intertwine, offering a powerful and imaginative narrative.

name: The Diary of a young girl
author: Anne Frank
description: The Diary of a Young Girl by Anne Frank is a poignant account of a Jewish girl's life hiding from the Nazis during WWII.

name: The Paris Novel
author: Ruth Reichl
description: The Paris Novel by Ruth Reichl is a culinary journey that blends romance and mystery with vibrant, food-centric storytelling in Paris.

name: In The Lonely Hours
author: Sharon Morgan
description: In the Lonely Hours by Sharon Morgan is a poignant exploration of solitude and self-discovery, weaving emotional depth with compelling storytelling.

name: Fahrenheit
author: Ray Bradbury
description: Fahrenheit 451 by Ray Bradbury is a dystopian tale where books are banned and burned, exploring censorship and conformity.

name: Field Guide to Love
author: India Holton
description: Field Guide to Love by India Holton is a whimsical romantic adventure that blends magic, humor, and heart, following a spirited journey of love and discovery.

name: The Book of Bill
author: Bill Zeitz
description: The Book of Bill by Bill Zeitz offers a humorous and insightful look at the life of an ordinary man, filled with quirky anecdotes and reflections.

name: Charlotte's web
author: E.B. White
description: Charlotte's Web by E.B. White is a heartwarming story of friendship between a pig named Wilbur and a clever spider, Charlotte.

name: Martyr
author: Kavesh Akbar
description: Martyr by Kavesh Akbar is a gripping thriller about sacrifice and redemption, exploring the dark paths of faith and courage.

name: The Ballad of Never After
author: Stephenie Garber
description: The Ballad of Never After by Stephanie Garber is a captivating fantasy where a young woman navigates a world of dark enchantments and perilous quests to uncover hidden truths and fight for love.

name: Romeo & Juliet
author: William Shakespeare
description: Romeo and Juliet by William Shakespeare is a tragic tale of two young lovers from feuding families, destined for heartbreak.

name: Wellness
author: Nathan Hill
description: Wellness by Nathan Hill is a thought-provoking exploration of health and self-care, blending personal journey with broader societal insights.

name: Sanctuary
author: Ilona Andrews
description: Sanctuary by Ilona Andrews is a thrilling sci-fi adventure featuring a fierce heroine fighting to protect a hidden refuge.

name: The outsiders
author: S.E. Hinton
description: The Outsiders by S.E. Hinton is a gripping story of teenage struggles, loyalty, and the divide between social classes.

name: What we Hide
author: Collean Coble
description: What We Hide by Colleen Coble is a suspenseful mystery unraveling dark secrets and hidden truths within a tight-knit community.

name: Anita De Monte Laughs Last
author: Xochitl Gonzalez
description: Anita de Monte Laughs Last by Xochitl Gonzalez is a vibrant and witty novel about a woman's quest for laughter, love, and self-discovery.

name: Holes
author: Loius Sachar
description: Holes by Louis Sachar is an adventurous tale of friendship, fate, and a mysterious family curse at a desert camp.

name: When The Rain Ends
author: Mary Ellen Taylor
description: When the Rain Ends by Mary Ellen Taylor is a poignant novel about love and healing, following characters navigating life's storms and finding hope.

name: Their unlikely Protector
author: Meghann Whistler
description: Their Unlikely Protector by Meghann Whistler is a heartwarming romance about an unexpected guardian who helps a woman find love and healing.

name: The vampire of voula
author: Alvaro Garcia
description: The Vampire of Voula by Alvaro García Marín is a chilling story blending mystery, myth, and suspense in a quiet Greek town.

name: The Hudson's Collection
author: Jocelyn Green
description: The Hudson Collection by Jocelyn Green features a gripping historical saga, blending romance and adventure set against a richly detailed historical backdrop.

name: Lovers at The Museum
description: Lovers at the Museum by Isabel Allende is a captivating romance set against the backdrop of art and history, exploring passion and connection.

name: The Bell jar
author: Sylvia Plath
description: The Bell Jar by Sylvia Plath explores a young woman's struggle with mental illness, identity, and societal expectations in 1950s America.

name: A Journey to Quiet the Chaos Within
author: Cory Richards
description: A Journey to Quiet The Chaos Within by Cory Richards is an introspective exploration of personal peace and self-discovery through nature's beauty.

name: Mastering AI
author: Jeremy Kahn
description: Mastering AI by Jeremy Kahn offers a comprehensive guide to understanding and harnessing artificial intelligence, with practical insights and applications.

name: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: The Shining by Stephen King is a chilling tale of a family's descent into madness at a haunted, isolated hotel.

name: Counting The Cost
author: Jill Duggar
description: Counting the Cost by Jill Duggar is a candid memoir that reflects on faith, family, and the personal sacrifices made for a life of devotion.

name: FrostBite
author: Nicola Twilley
description: Frostbite by Nicola Twilley explores the intersection of science and climate change, delving into the impact of frozen environments on our world.

name: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: Jane Eyre by Charlotte Brontë tells the story of an orphaned girl who overcomes hardships and finds love and independence.

name: We are not able to live in the sky
author: Adam Grant
description: Think Again by Adam Grant examines the power of rethinking and unlearning, encouraging readers to challenge assumptions and embrace new perspectives.

name: The Future Was Now
author: Chris Nashawaty
description: The Future Was Now by Chris Nashawaty explores the transformative impact of technology and pop culture on society, blending insightful analysis with engaging storytelling.

name: The old man and the sea
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: The Old Man and the Sea by Ernest Hemingway is about an aging fisherman’s struggle with a giant marlin and his enduring spirit.

name: Do Something
author: Guy Trebay
description: Do Something by Guy Trebay examines the art of personal and societal change, offering a compelling look at activism and making a difference.

name: Think Again
author: Mara Kardas Nelson
description: We Are Not Able to Live in the Sky by Mara Kardas-Nelson is a poignant exploration of human resilience and connection through evocative storytelling and rich imagery.

name: Life of Pie
author: Yann Martell
description: Life of Pi by Yann Martel is about a young boy stranded on a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger, exploring survival and faith.

name: The Last Sane Woman
author: Hannah Regel
description: The Last Sane Woman by Hannah Regel is a gripping psychological thriller that delves into the mind of a woman unraveling amidst chaos and deceit.

name: Talking to Strangers
author: Malcolm Gladwell
description: Talking to Strangers by Malcolm Gladwell investigates the complexities and pitfalls of our interactions with unfamiliar people, revealing insights into human behavior and miscommunication.
